result.execSummary:
The defendant William Alex Novak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland TODAY!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
All financial obligations are placed on a payment plan. Defendant's payments are $25 per month beginning 5/4/16

Def to obtain domestic abuse/perpetrators counseling as directed and complete recommendations.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.  Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
NO CONTACT WITH L.B.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

timeConds.notes: 20 hours of community service to be completed and written verification provided to his agent whin 6 months of conviction

records.addlTxt: Defendant William Alex Novak in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA agreement ( see offer to settle filed 4/4/16). Def and atty state that is the agreement. Charges and penalties read, understands charges and penalties. Plea N/C to each count admits charges Ct2 15CF214 and Ct 4 16CF32 are acts of domestic abuse. Ct 1 in 15CF214 and Cts 2,3,5,6 in 16CF32 read in and dismissed. CT accepts plea finds def Guilty.  State complied with victim rights.  Sentencing as proposed. To report to DOC today, MH assessment and follow through. Cash bail applied
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant William Alex Novak appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann in court, defendant William Alex Novak not in court, in custody.  Def does not obj to St's mo for joinder - Ct GRANTS mo for joinder.  4/11 JT (bth cases & feel can be done in 1 day).  St oppose mo for modif of bail.  Atty gives argumt for modif of bond.  Ct denies modif of bond.
Def's notice of motion and motion for modification of bail conditions
for joinder or in the alternative motion for other acts

Defendant William Alex Novak appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann in court.  No agreemt.  Jury trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Wants atty.  AIA 11-09-2015 at 10:30 a.m.  State opposes victims request for modifying bond.  Lynn Ann Brown comments - want him to come back home.  No fear of him.  Motion to modify bond is denied.
from LB to Judge with Safety Plan
def maintain absolute sobriety; no contact with Lynn Brown or her residence; not to be present where MAS sold or cosumed.
